In a surveillance study of pediatric and adult HCT recipients in the first year after transplant, the most common viruses detected were HRV and HCoV, followed by PIV, adenovirus, RSV, influenza, HMPV, and human bocavirus.
1 In a separate multicenter retrospective study of pediatric HCT recipients, 16.6% of patient had at least one respiratory virus detected by PCR in the first year after HCT
2 ; younger age was associated with viral detection in univariate analysis. Steroid exposure, neutropenia, and lymphopenia were commonly present in the week before respiratory viral onset.
